title: Maintenance Manager
description:
Overview:

POSITION SUMMARY:


The Maintenance Manager is responsible for overseeing the Jersey City Site Maintenance Shop and managing a team of technicians, welders and administrative personnel who are responsible for the preventive maintenance and repair of fleet equipment. The Maintenance Manager is responsible for providing direction to a team of technicians. Responsibilities include implementing and monitoring maintenance policies and procedures to ensure that all repairs and maintenance of Interstate Waste Services/ Action Environmental Service’s equipment, including trucks, containers, and other heavy-duty equipment, are performed in compliance with the Company's safety and compliance standards, and in compliance with all federal and state regulations.


PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:


Provide direction to technicians, welders, and administrative personnel to ensure that all repair/ maintenance work is performed in a safe, efficient, and timely manner, reallocating resources among sites as appropriate. Oversee coordination, planning & scheduling of all repair work to increase productivity, while effectively managing department's overtime. Monitor the shops operational performance and efficiency and take action to redirect activities appropriately. Report to Leadership on shops' performance; implement procedures for process/programmatic changes for improvement or efficiencies.


Manage daily shop safety meetings; fleet walk-arounds; coaching and counseling of maintenance team personnel and conduct corrective action, when necessary; make hiring/ termination decisions in concert with Human Resources and appropriate management; oversee employee training and performance evaluations; evaluate, recommend and approve maintenance personnel recommendations for merit increase, promotion and job changes, as appropriate.


Maintain an on-going preventive maintenance program for all shops within area of responsibility. Identify trends in road calls/ break downs; oversee maintenance of building and other facility needs on site; control maintenance costs relating to personnel, purchasing, inventory control and outsourcing of repairs.


Perform inspections of outside repairs and maintenance to ensure all work is properly completed in accordance with Company safety and compliance procedures and federal and state regulations; follow up where appropriate. Identify training opportunities and, as necessary, document issues and constructively discuss corrective action, as needed, with maintenance personnel.


Accountable for scheduled Quality Control Inspections, track issues and resolution to ensure all work is properly completed in accordance with Company safety and compliance procedures, and federal and state regulations.


Maintain advanced knowledge of engine, emission systems, transmission, brake, hydraulic and electrical systems of heavy equipment and vehicles used by Company to ensure ability to perform advanced preventive and repair maintenance functions, on site and on road, including: Advanced engine chassis repair and maintenance; Advanced knowledge of vehicle body control systems, including hydraulics and electrical systems to maintain and repair vehicles in a timely and safe manner; Advanced knowledge of heating and air conditioning systems to effectively diagnose and repair complex heating and cooling systems in vehicles in a timely and safe manner; and Advance knowledge of welding tools to fix heavy equipment in a safe and efficient manner to ensure equipment is back in an operable condition as quickly and as safely as possible.


Manage related administrative matters for team, including payroll, maintenance of employee records, records of all preventive and corrective maintenance performed, recording of all information into Maintenance Software, prepare and submit budget for approval, set departmental goals to align with company targets and performance objectives established by leadership.

  


Responsibilities:

QUALIFICATIONS:


Knowledge of basic computer skills and Microsoft Office.


Advanced Root Cause Problem Solving.


Effective and professional communications skills.


Strong customer service orientation.


Ability to anticipate business needs and plan accordingly to ensure that equipment. employee and fiscal resources are utilized in the most efficient manner.


High level of analytical skill to develop a range of possible solutions to address a wide range of issues.


Organizational skills.


Ability to collaborate and encourage employee engagement.


Good financial management and planning skills; ability to understand financial terms, budgets, tables and reports. Ability to develop realistic, comprehensive plans to make efficient use of resources.


Automotive Service Excellence T2 Diesel Engine, T Master Certified. T3 Drive T4 Brake TS Suspension and Steering.


At-least-5-years-of experience as a Maintenance Manager or Maintenance Supervisor for a large fleet of vehicles or multiple site locations requiring knowledge and application of OSHA Haz Com and OSHA Lock Out Tag Out.


Qualifications:
**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:**


High school diploma or G.E.D.


3 years of leadership experience


Additional Information:
**Career opportunities**
We believe in providing the training and development you need to grow your career with Interstate Waste Services. Many of our Supervisors, Managers, and other leadership staff, started their careers as Helpers, Drivers, or Dispatchers. IWS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.**Salary and benefits**
Interstate Waste Services is committed to providing a world class work place to all employees. Each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including, competitive pay, 401k benefits with company match, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and more. Our employees also receive Paid Time Off and Holidays.
Salary Range Minimum: USD $100,000.00/Yr. Salary Range Maximum: USD $120,000.00/Yr.

LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS THAT CAN START IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!!!!!!

POTENTIALLY PERMANENT POSITION DEPENDING ON PROVEN TRACK ABILITY

We are an Digital Printing company that currently focuses solely on providing apparel for some of today's hottest streetwear brands and designers. We are actively growing and are looking for someone to help with the day-to-day of fulfilling orders. The role will handle the entirety of fulfilling apparel, from placing artwork on the apparel - Digital Printing, to packing and shipping the order.

We want a motivated candidate that pays attention to detail and works great in a team environment with production deadlines. Experience with apparel decoration is a huge plus, but any hard worker that is willing to learn will be considered.

We are also very open to the idea of the candidate growing in the role and taking on responsibilities in other departments if they would like. The ideal candidate doesn't mind helping with maintenance around the warehouse.

**Required: Physically capable - this position requires you to be on your feet for the vast majority of the day, and to lift heavy boxes / move equipment (up to 50lbs).**

Attention to detail - there is a lot of nuance in making the apparel, so any candidate will need to pay attention to even the smallest parts of the role.

**Open mindedness / positive attitude - this role can be challenging and isn't always the most fun.**

title: HR Marketing Assistant/Payroll
description:
**The Company**

Core Health Management is a Healthcare Management Service Organization (MSO) that provides all administrative support for behavioral health and healthcare practitioners including scheduling, billing, credentialing, recruiting, onboarding, and other related administrative tasks.

**The Position**

The HR Marketing Assistant supports our employee population by providing the structure, care and development needed for individual employees to be successful in their own careers, which in turn contributes to the overall growth and success of the company.

As the HR Marketing Assistant, you will be providing administrative support in the Human Resources Department with a concentration in payroll and marketing. We are looking for someone who is tech-savvy, experienced, or highly interested in web design and marketing, familiar with our HRIS, and experienced with running payroll for a small to medium sized company (1-100 employees).

The position has the following responsibilities:

-Monitor weekly timesheets. Review timesheets that are not approved. Assist employees with timekeeping inquiries, personnel inquiries, monitoring of staff on leave and conducting appropriate follow-up with employees who are expected to return to duty. Maintains the integrity and confidentiality of HR files and records.

-Compensation and Benefits: run bi-monthly payroll, coordinate health insurance benefits and enrollment, retirement plan benefits, and other related benefits.

-Performance management, employee relations, recruiting and retaining talent, including posting job ads and follow-up on job applications, onboarding and training, coaching and counseling.

-Maintain highly organized workflows and provide excellent internal customer service, which will be critical in ensuring that all companies function smoothly and effectively so that each company can meet their strategic goals.

-Support employee engagement, organize HR team events and activities.

title: Host/Hostess
description:
We are looking for an experienced Hosts that likes fast paced environments along with great energy!


We seek responsible, kind, hardworking individuals, with a positive and professional attitude and work-ethic. Our ideal candidates will bring genuine passion for service, hospitality, and enjoy working in a fast paced, high energy work environment.


This exciting Chelsea restaurant Shukette has been heralded by the NY Times for its "extroverted, generous spirit" and an approach to Middle Eastern Cooking that is "long overdue in New York." Led by Chef Ayesha Nurdjaja, a 2022 James Beard Award finalist for Best New Chef: New York, Shukette has been recognized as one of the top new restaurants in the city. Every night feels like a warm and breezy Summer evening at a cafe on the Mediterranean coast. Esoteric wines sourced from around the region and captivating fortified and aromatized cocktails round out our beverage program which perfectly complements the food.

title: Inventory Control Coordinator
description:
Reports To: Warehouse Supervisor

Scope: 

To ensure that all inventories issued to Production Orders are posted accurately and in a timely fashion. Investigate discrepancies overages and provide analyses thereof.

Responsibilities: 

* Analyze all inventory discrepancies related to production orders
* Verify that all material transactions are performed and evaluated for accuracy
* Back-up Receiving Clerk
* Make inventory adjustments as required based on Work Orders and product movement in the QAD system
* Report nonconformance conditions (either product or process) to appropriate personnel
* Participate in self-development and training of others on QAD system
* Perform other related duties as required or directed by manager
* Conduct inventory cycle counts with warehouse personnel
* Maintain inventory system with warehouse management
* Monitor daily excess usage, investigate and report all findings
* Transaction entry
* Generate daily production documentation as necessary
* Close out process and reporting working closely with the finance

Qualifications: 

* Experience in related field
* Able to work independently and as part of the team
* Analytical skills necessary to fulfill job responsibilities
* Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
* Experience Computer (PC), data collection, and analysis skills necessary to fulfill job responsibilities
* Math skills necessary to fulfill job responsibilities
* Must have a good command of the English Language, both written and verbal

The person in this position is required to communicate to employees in all position levels. He/she must be able to exchange accurate information in these circumstances.

This person must be able to stay in a stationary position up to 80 % of the time.

This person must be able to lift and transport boxes and/or totes up to 25 pounds.

Training: New hires or transfers into this position shall be given a three-month trial orientation period in order to become proficient. Proficiency shall be evaluated by the area manager or trainer and become part of the employee’s training record.

title: Stepdown Unit RN
description:
**Position:** Stepdown Unit Registered Nurse (RN)  
**Location:** New York, NY 10025  
**Job Type:** Full-time, Travel, Temp, W2  
**Shift:** 3x12 - Nights (7:00 PM - 7:00 AM) - Rotating weekends  
**Weekly Pay:** $2,340 (Travel Package Offered)

**Job Description:**

* Provide specialized care for patients requiring higher monitoring than a general unit, but less than intensive care.
* Administer medications, IV fluids, and blood products per physician orders and protocols.
* Monitor vital signs, cardiac rhythms, and oxygenation; respond promptly to changes.
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary healthcare teams to develop and implement care plans.
* Assist with bedside procedures such as central line placement and ventilator management.
* Educate patients and families on conditions, treatment options, and self-care techniques.
* Accurately document nursing assessments, interventions, and patient responses.
* Adhere to hospital policies, infection control, and patient safety protocols.
* Participate in interdisciplinary rounds, quality improvement initiatives, and staff education.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Nursing (ASN accepted in enrolled into BSN program)
* Current Registered Nurse (RN) license in New York.
* Minimum of 2 years of acute care nursing experience, specifically in stepdown/intermediate care.
* BLS and ACLS certifications required.
* Willingness to work rotating shifts, including weekends and holidays.

**Benefits:** Medical, dental, vision, 401k + match, paid sick time, weekly direct deposit, referral bonus

*We look forward to reviewing your application!*

Job Types: Full-time, Travel nursing, Contract, Temporary

title: Personal Insurance CSR/Account Manager
description:
Insurance Account Manager

Job Overview:  
We are seeking a dedicated Insurance Account Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing client accounts, providing exceptional customer service, and promoting insurance products. As an Insurance Account Manager, you will play a crucial role in maintaining client relationships, analyzing insurance needs, and ensuring customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:  
- Communicate with clients to understand their insurance requirements and provide suitable solutions  
- Manage and maintain client accounts by processing policy changes, renewals, and claims efficiently  
- Conduct market research to stay informed about insurance trends and offerings  
- Utilize HIPAA regulations to handle sensitive client information securely  
- Collaborate with the sales team to support outside sales efforts and promote insurance products  
- Conduct telemarketing activities to reach out to potential clients and expand the customer base  
- Negotiate terms and coverage options with insurance providers on behalf of clients  
- Analyze insurance policies to ensure they meet clients' needs and provide recommendations for adjustments  
- Provide multilingual support, especially in Spanish, to cater to diverse client needs  
- Assist in benefits administration for clients by explaining coverage details and assisting with claims processes

Qualifications:  
- Proven experience in insurance account management or a related field is preferred  
- Strong negotiation skills with the ability to analyze complex insurance policies  
- Proficiency in Spanish is a plus to communicate effectively with Spanish-speaking clients  
- Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks effectively, and work in a fast-paced environment  
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact with clients and team members  
- Attention to detail and accuracy when handling client accounts and policy details  
- Familiarity with retail sales practices and customer service principles is beneficial

Join our team as an Insurance Account Manager and enjoy competitive compensation, health benefits, opportunities for career growth, and a dynamic work environment. If you are passionate about insurance services and possess the required skills, we encourage you to apply today.

title: Account Executive I, Growth Commercial
description:
Job Description:
Rakuten International oversees 7 businesses with over 4,000 employees globally. The brand is recognized for its leadership and innovation in e-commerce, digital content, advertising, entertainment and communications, bringing the joy of discovery and access to more than 1 billion members across the world. Our teams deliver on the company’s mission to delight merchants and customers through innovation, optimism, and teamwork.  

  

Rakuten Rewards is a leading e-commerce company that enhances the way people shop by offering Cash Back, deals and rewards from more than 3,500 merchants. Founded in 1999, Rakuten has grown to become the go-to shopping destination for consumers, having paid out nearly $2 billion in Cash Back to its 15 million members. The company also operates ShopStyle, a leading fashion discovery destination, and Cartera Commerce, a top rewards platform for airlines and banks. For more information, visit www.rakuten.com.  

SUMMARY:
As an Account Executive for the Canadian Rakuten Business, you will use your experience selling digital advertising solutions to large advertisers and their ad agencies in both the US and Canada to successfully grow and scale domestic revenues. Through client-side and agency relationships, a consultative approach and understanding of the digital advertising landscape, you will act as a strategic partner to your assigned merchants and sell a broad range of Ad Media placements and packages that will ensure that their business goals are met. As an individual contributor, you will work closely with the General Manager & Director of Sales and will be supported by the Account Manager and Associate Account Manager.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintain and grow current Enterprise accounts, developing broader relationships, gaining customer insights, and meeting annual revenue and growth goals. Partner with the General Manage, & Director of Sales to build strategies targeted to meet both the client' and internal objectives. Possess expertise in mobile solutions, apps and digital commerce. Experience in designing, proposing, selling and overseeing the execution of projects. Demonstrate strong analytic insight and ability to communicate / deliver findings while providing exemplary and timely client service. Has a proven track record of growing ad media revenue of $10M+ annually. Is able to travel in the US and Canada, up to 30% of the year.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities)
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* 5+ years' experience closing media sales and generating revenue
* Experience working closely with brands and agencies
* Demonstrated ability to consistently close sales and generate revenues
* Strong track record of high-level negotiation and successful internal and external relationship management
* Strong analytical abilities
* Able to work in a fast-paced environment with technical and non-technical teams to translate customer needs into actionable items
* Ability to interact with a broad set of businesses and presenting both over the phone and in person
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and good follow-through


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS* Bachelor's Degree or Relevant work experience


Five Principles for Success  

Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.  

  

Always improve, Always Advance - Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen  

Passionately Professional - Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best  

Hypothesize - Practice - Validate – Shikumika - Use the Rakuten Cycle to succeed in unknown territory  

Maximize Customer Satisfaction - The greatest satisfaction for our teams is seeing their customers smile  

Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! - Always be conscious of time - take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team*Rakuten provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type. Rakuten considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws.**At the time of posting, Rakuten expects the base compensation for this role to be within the range shown below. Individual compensation will vary based on job-related factors, including the skills, qualifications, and experience of the successful candidate as well as business need and geographic location.* *The successful applicant for this role will be eligible for discretionary bonus, health, vision, dental insurance, 401k matching, PTO, Volunteer Time Off (VTO), and other employee benefits as the company implements.*

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Excellent opportunity for an experienced Human Resources professional. The HR Manager will provide the full continuum of generalist duties in the functional areas of Human Resources to include, onboarding, employee relations, HRIS administration, and performance management. The ideal candidate will understand applicable federal and state labor laws, possess knowledge of personnel policies and practices, and have the ability to handle delegated administrative details with strong communications skills.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------


* Excellent communication skills
* Commitment to employee satisfaction
* Able to work with all levels of management in a collaborative manner
* Strong analytical skills and critical thinking skills
* Must be able to function in a demanding work environment
* Ability to handle multiple priorities and tasks
* Must be dependable, able to work well with others as well as independently
* Must have knowledge of computers, telephone systems, and all basic office equipment
* Strong Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
* Advanced knowledge of ADP-HRB HRIS system necessary

**Duties / Responsibilities**
-----------------------------


* Responsible for managing the overall daily transactional processes of the Human Resources department to ensure quality HR service delivery to our organization's team members
* Responsible for coordinating new employee orientation and other HR special programs
* Provides necessary statistical data for hospital committees and Human Resources Director
* Conducts exit interviews and analyzes exit interview data to report key findings
* Maintains comprehensive Performance Evaluation program
* Assist the Exec. Director of Human Resources with various research and special projects
* In coordination with HR Staff, ensures maintenance of employee records as well as other HR tasks
* Supports and assists in Employee Relations investigations and issues
* Responsible for advertising current vacant positions through collaboration with our Marketing department and outside agencies
* Oversees the coordination of volunteer program
* Responsible for weekly changes report and bonus tracking, continuing education, and licensing reimbursement
* Responsible for the onboarding process of new hires
* Responsible for providing HR metrics and statistical data reporting including KPI's
* Responsible for direction of the onboarding process of new hires, including orientation and offer letters
* Coordinates the Employee Length of Service Program along with the HR Generalist
* Coordinates Interns/Resident graduation with office of medical affairs & department

**Knowledge Of**
----------------


* ADP-Workforce Now is preferred
* HR federal laws and regulations
* Advanced knowledge of MS Office, HRIS systems, ATS, and comfortable learning new technical systems as needed

**Required Skills/Abilities**
-----------------------------


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
* Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
* Ability to think conceptually, anticipate outcomes from existing/emerging circumstances/settings, and perceive reconfiguration of resources to meet organizational needs and timelines
* Proficiency with, or the ability to quickly learn, the organization's HRIS and talent management systems

 **Direction of Others**
-----------------------


* Human Resources Assistant

**Education and Experience**
----------------------------


* Bachelor's degree in human resources, Business Administration, or related field required
* At least 7-10 years of human resource management experience necessary
* Non-profit or healthcare environment a plus
* SHRM-CP a plus

**Physical Requirements**
-------------------------


* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
* Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times
* Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organization's facilities

**Benefits Package Includes**
-----------------------------


* Competitive salary
* Generous paid time off
* 50% discount on veterinary care
* Continuing education funds with rollover options
* 403(b) matching
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
* You may be eligible for The Public Loan Service Forgiveness Program as we are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit employer


**AMC's Commitment to Lifelong Learning**
-----------------------------------------



The Schwarzman Animal Medical Center is located in Manhattan, near a multitude of leading research and teaching hospitals. AMC's commitment to compassionate and pioneering veterinary care dates to 1910 when it was founded as a clinic to help animals whose owners could not afford treatment. We continue this legacy today as the world's largest non-profit animal hospital, with 130+ veterinarians working collaboratively across 20 specialties and services. Our team prides itself on delivering world class veterinary care to help keep pet families together.



When you join the team at AMC, you join a renowned team of veterinary professionals dedicated to innovative care, research, and education. Our prestigious postgraduate education programs attract future leaders in veterinary medicine, and the clinical research conducted at AMC has led to breakthroughs that change the way veterinary care is delivered industry wide. This shared commitment to learning, teaching, and innovative care creates a collegial, collaborative environment with rewarding opportunities for advancement and growth.



We're building the future of veterinary medicine at the Schwarzman Animal Medical Center, thanks to our transformative Gift of Love campaign to expand and enhance our clinical, educational, and research capacities. Construction is currently underway to fully renovate the hospital, ensuring AMC is at the forefront of veterinary medicine for generations to come.

title: Patient Care Coordinator - West Village
description:
At Tend, we do dental differently.

Tend is rewriting the playbook of modern dentistry by building a company around the patient and the provider. We believe that with the power of technology, a hospitality-driven mindset, and a top tier clinical team, we can make going to the dentist something to look forward to. Our vision is to transform the dental experience into one that is empowering, human and personalized.


Since launching in 2019, we have provided exceptional care to over 100,000 patients across five major cities: New York, Washington DC, Boston, Atlanta and Nashville. With thousands of five-star reviews, Tend has become one of the country's top-rated and in-demand dental practices, with over 650 team members to support this mission. We're continuing to grow quickly and looking for the best of the best to come join our team.

### **Responsibilities:**


- Welcome & comfort guests as they visit our Tend studio.
- Provide consistent, high-quality service and hospitality to guests, in-studio, and as needed, through email or by phone.
- Partner with the Studio Manager in daily operational tasks, such as scheduling, tidying, preparing for closing/opening, and inventory management.
- Collaborate with the entire Studio Team, including our Dentists & clinicians, to optimize operations to positive impact guest experience.
- Maintain a strong knowledge of our ever-growing offering of products & services.
### **Qualifications & Experiences:**


- Proven top-notch customer service and hospitality experience in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
- Ability to organize, prioritize and multitask.
- Willingness to initiate tasks and perform duties without direct supervision.
- Excellent communication skills and be able to work with a diverse team.
- A positive, can-do attitude.
- Flexibility to work a schedule that may include early morning, late evening, holiday and weekend hours.
### **The Tend Difference**


**The highest standard of care, anywhere.**
You'll work with highly-esteemed clinical leadership and experience-obsessed colleagues to provide the best patient experience possible, with access to technology that's head and shoulders above the average practice. You'll have exciting opportunities to collaborate with talented team members to make visits extraordinary. Our hospitality-driven approach to care means that patients actually look forward to seeing you.

**A top-tier clinical team who puts patients first.**
We value science over sales, and promote a culture of warmth and hospitality — our teams are recognized for going the extra mile for our patients. We trust our providers to put patient needs first, and never implement production quotas. We offer a warm, collaborative culture and are proud to be an inclusive, curious team driven by excellence.

**A new model that's a joy to work at.**
Tend has become beloved by patients and providers alike for combining beautiful work environments with cutting-edge clinical technology. Our providers are rewarded based on an innovative pay structure, as well as education programs that are training the next generation of industry leaders. And our top-notch total rewards packages include both best-in-class benefits and compensation. You'll not only have the chance to be part of a thriving, industry-changing company, but empowered to become an expert in your field and supported through continuing education.

**Tend is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**
Tend is committed to promoting a work environment in which differences are respected, employees are treated fairly, and individual contributions are valued and rewarded. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Please refer to our Privacy Policies linked here.
company_description: Tend is a dental services provider reimagining dentistry from the ground up and building new dental studios in major metro areas across the U.S. including NYC, DC, Boston, Atlanta and Nashville.

title: Detective Specialist
company: Office of the New York State Attorney General
description:
**Attorney General of the State of New York**  

**Division of Investigations**

  

  

**EMPLOYMENT ANNOUNCEMENT**  



**DETECTIVE SPECIALIST: SPECIAL OPERATIONS UNIT (INVESTIGATIONS DIVISION) – WHITE PLAINS, NY**

The New York State Office of the Attorney General (“OAG”), Investigations Division is seeking an experienced
  

candidate for appointment to Detective Specialist for its Special Operations Unit Computer Forensic Investigative
  

Team (CFIT) located in White Plains. The Investigations Division’s Special Operations Unit provides operational
  

investigative technical expertise and support to all Divisions, Bureaus and Units within the Office of the Attorney
  

General.
  

  

The CFIT team is responsible for all computer and electronic device related forensic work, including the seizure and
  

extraction of data from devices at search warrant scenes and the proper handling of evidence for eventual analysis.
  

This is a Statewide Unit with 24x7x365 responsibilities. Candidates should be of high moral character, hard-  

working, motivated and committed to public service on behalf of the people of the State of New York.
  

  

**Duties:**  

  

* Perform digital forensics for active criminal and civil investigations, including but not limited to; Mobile device
extractions, seizure and imaging of PC’s and laptops, DVR extractions, website captures, data recovery from a
  

variety of technology-based sources.


* Participate with criminal investigators and other law enforcement officers in active criminal investigations and

apply advanced investigative techniques to gather evidence and intelligence that facilitate the prosecution of
  

violations of criminal laws.
* Participate in the planning and execution of the electronic surveillance phase of major investigative and

enforcement operations.
* Provide investigative support for complex internet investigations.
* Assist other members of the unit with making covert court ordered entry onto/into the property of targets of

criminal investigations to install equipment to collect evidence.
  

  

**Minimum qualifications include:**  

  

* Must have a current NYS basic police academy certification approved by DCJS.
* Minimum of 3 years’ experience performing digital forensic work including but not limited to; Mobile device
extraction and analysis, imaging hard drives, seizure, imaging, and analysis of PC’s, laptops and Macs,
  

recovering video data from DVR surveillance systems, website capture and analysis.


* Candidate must possess the capability of articulating complicated computer forensic concepts to audiences

with limited technical knowledge.
* The NYS Public Officer’s Law requires that all police officers be citizens of the United States of America and

reside within the State of New York at the time of appointment.
* Must possess a valid NYS Driver’s License with ability to operate a motor vehicle.
* Must possess strong writing, analytical and organizational skills.
* Demonstrated strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary

investigative team.
  

* Certification and experiences with industry standard tools for extraction of mobile devices such as Cellebrite,
XRY, Oxygen.
  

* Experience with the Development and documentation of digital forensic policies and standard operating
procedures.
  

* Experience with tool sourcing, procurement, testing, and license maintenance.
* Experience testifying before Grand Jury and Court proceedings.
* Proficiency and/or direct experience in computer network administration and support; ability to install and
maintain computer equipment, software and computer peripherals.

  



**Attorney General of the State of New York**  

**Division of Investigations**

  

  

  

**Preferred qualifications, skills and education:**  

  

* Industry recognized certification(s) such as CFCE from IACIS.
* Certification in use of social media discovery tools such as X1 Social Discovery.
* Experience with online based investigations utilizing OSINT techniques.
* Experience recovering video evidence from DVR surveillance systems.
* Experience with participating on search warrants for the seizure of electronic equipment.
* Experience with the implementation and/or management of a forensic management platform such as Magnet
Atlas or similar.
  

* Experience in other technical areas such as electronic eavesdropping and wiretapping, knowledge and
understanding of State and Federal laws pertaining to technical, electronic, audio, video surveillance.  

  



Performance of the duties may require frequent, unscheduled work on evenings and weekends and requires 24/7
  

availability. This position is in the exempt class, and incumbents serve at the pleasure of the Attorney General. The
  

hire rate for this position is $84,980. Appointments in this location receive an additional $3,400 location pay.


**How to apply: Please respond to Reference No. INV\\_SOU\\_WP\\_7205\\_090924 as outlined below. Deadline for**  

**responding is September 9, 2024.**

Applications are being received online.
  

Applicants will be taken to the online application page for this position. Applicants must be prepared to submit a
  

complete application packet consisting of a cover letter (including the reference no. **INV\\_SOU\\_WP\\_7205\\_090924**),
  

resume and list of references. You may address your cover letter to Investigator Jobs. For questions about an
  

Investigator position with the OAG, the application process or assistance with submitting your application, please
  

email Investigator.jobs@ag.ny.gov or call 518-776-2500.


***Candidates from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.***

***The OAG is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to workplace diversity.***

title: General Manager
description:
***Overview:***

Join the World of Bowling! Here at Bowl 360 We pride ourselves on excellent guest experience. As General Manager your role is all about giving exceptional service and leading your team to success. You will be responsible for the daily operations of the center. Including safety, sales, profits, staffing, overall image of the bowling center. You will be responsible for the administration of business goals including; revenues, expense, profitability, customer satisfaction, employee morale, etc. You will training, evaluate, and motivate the staff to succeed to reach sales goals, follow all process and procedures, keeping upbeat attitude, and so much more. You will work hands on with the staff to be sure all are trained successfully, assist with parties, special events, weekly promotions, and any other duties as directed by management. Cross trained on all areas of business to support staff where and when needed for business success.

***Responsibilities***:

* Oversee day-to-day operations
* Design strategy and set goals for growth
* Ensuring that company guidelines are followed
* Maintain budgets and optimize expenses
* Setting up and organizing schedules
* Devising and setting up objectives to boost company productivity
* Ensuring that goals and objectives are met
* Maintaining a safe and clean work environment
* Interviewing and recruiting new employees
* Ensure employees work productively and develop professionally
* Providing training to staff
* Delegating tasks to staff
* Prepare regular reports for upper management
* Supervising, leading and motivating staff
* Reporting any problems or accidents to senior management
* Filling in for senior management in case of their absence
* Helping with monitoring and tracking operating costs, budgets and resources
* Creating reports, analyzing, interpreting and presenting data
* Monitoring customer and client satisfaction
* Managing customer complaints and resolving their issues
* Assisting with procurement of inventory and supplies
* Supporting the general manager as needed

\\*

***Knowledge, Skills and Abilities***:

* Bachelor's Degree in business administration or similar field preferred
* Minimum of 4 years of experience as an General Manager or similar role
* Experience in recruiting and hiring
* Experience in evaluating staff
* Experience in leadership roles
* Ability to plan and organize
* Excellent multitasking skills
* Proficiency in using MS Office
* Ability to work well in a team environment
* Ability to work well under pressure
* Flexibility
* Adaptability

* Keen strategic thinking and planning
* Understanding of budget management and financial monitoring
* Excellent leadership skills, including goal setting, motivating, training and mentorship
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including writing, speaking and active listening
* Effective conflict resolution and problem-solving skills
* Good organization and time management
* Comfortable in a fast-paced or high-pressure environment

title: Social Media & Creative Associate
description:
Job Summary:

**\\*\\*If you feel you’d make a great fit for us, we would love to hear from you! Please send a brief email about why you are right for this position, a resume in PDF format, and samples of your work (this could be links to your website, photo/video content, social media, graphic design work, etc.) to: careers@lukelampco.com\\*\\*—**

Our high-end lighting design and manufacturing studio (www.lukelampco.com) is looking for a Creative Associate to play a key role in building our brand awareness, client relationships, web & social media presence, and more. We take pride in being friendly, detail-oriented, and always going above and beyond for our clients, and we are looking for someone who is committed to carrying on these standards.

This role will be a hybrid position - you must be able to be in our NYC Nolita showroom, as well as Mamaroneck, NY studio, 2-3 days per week (or more as needed).

Duties/Responsibilities

* Overall responsibility for maintaining and improving Luke Lamp Co. social media accounts (Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok), including:
* Create and post content regularly (including reels, stories, posts, TikTok, etc.)
* Responding to messages and comments.
* Ensuring frequent engagement across platforms.
* Staying up to date on the platform changes to ensure we follow best practices.
* Engaging consultants to assist with strategy, content, etc., as needed.
* Responsible for all photo/video-related content. This includes:
* Capturing high-quality photography and videography regularly in our Mamaroneck, NY studio, NYC Nolita showroom, and on location for use on our website, social media, etc.
* Acquiring props and creating styled scenes for photo/video content in the studio.
* Locating and acquiring photo/video assets from completed projects for use on the website and social media.
* Keep our photo assets database organized and up to date and look for opportunities to improve functionality.
* Execute the brand & marketing strategy for Luke Lamp Co.
* Help shape and communicate our vision and mission.
* Maintain a database of publicly accessible locations and identify opportunities to put our fixtures in new public locations.
* Regularly create and distribute email newsletters and physical mailers for new fixture launches, company announcements, etc.
* Collaborate with leadership and sales team on implementing strategies for performing proactive outreach to current and prospective clients.
* Regularly update the website for new product launches as well as to improve the look/feel and usability of the website, including the layout, photo assets, copy, SEO, etc.
* Help with creating and managing graphics for various areas of the business including: packaging, sample kits, mailers/brochures, website, etc.
* Assist with technical graphics and copywriting across various platforms with the goal of clearly conveying complex concepts.
* Assist in event planning as needed (trade shows, meetings, etc.)
* Track analytics on social media platforms and the website to identify areas of improvement and increase reach.

Required Skills/Qualifications: *Please note that the below qualifications are meant to serve as a guideline. If you feel you’ll make a great fit, we want to hear more!*

* Experience working with interior design/architecture firms, lighting, high-end retail/showroom environments, or a related industry is highly preferred.
* Ability to be in-person 2-3 days per week in our NYC Nolita showroom, our Mamaroneck studio, and/or on location in NYC.
* Hands-on experience in content management.
* Knowledge and interest in social media marketing.
* Excellent understanding of the full marketing mix.
* Very strong verbal and written communication skills, including copywriting ability.
* Experience with photography and videography, including creating content for social media.
* Experience working with Adobe Creative Suite and/or other photo/video editing and graphic design software.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Interest in finding creative ways to communicate and engage with our customer base.
* Willingness to take on a wide variety of responsibilities and learn new systems/processes quickly.

Our Values

* We are committed to constantly improving our processes.
* We seek to provide the best tool for every task.
* We value a positive, supportive work environment.
* We listen to employee feedback and are open to new ideas.

Benefits

* 31 days annual paid time off (including 16 floating holidays) plus 5 additional days of unpaid time off
* 15 days annual sick leave
* Paid week off between Christmas and New Year’s Day
* Summer Fridays (half days) from Memorial Day - Labor Day (you are paid for the full day)
* Health & Wellness stipend ($50/month)
* 401K Match (5%)
* Quarterly profit sharing bonus
* Healthcare Reimbursement Program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Tuition Reimbursement

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

title: Case Manager (RISE-Rehousing in Supportive Environments)
company: Caring for the Hungry & Homeless of Peekskill
description:
**General Description:** Our focus at CHHOP (Caring for the Hungry and Homeless of Peekskill) is housing and food equity. We operate a shelter for unhoused adults of all genders, including veterans, a collaborative housing and services support program for domestic violence survivors and their families, a permanent supportive hosing program for chronically homeless individuals living with a disability, a large “farm to pantry” food pantry, and a rental arrears and communities services support program for low-wage workers and immigrants. The RISE case manager is responsible for assisting domestic violence survivors and their families achieve and maintain safety and self-sufficiency

**RISE Program:** The Rehousing in Supportive Environments Program (RISE) is a collaborative program providing case management, housing, domestic violence, supportive services, and employment services to homeless domestic violence survivors and their families. This collaborative model was intentionally designed to provide “wrap-around” services in one program.

**Principal Activities:**

· Work directly with individuals and families referred to RISE

· Work directly with collaborative partners

· Organize, schedule, and follow up on monthly meetings with program partners

· Conduct intake/assessment and develop service plans

· Assist clients with overcoming barriers to maintaining permanent housing

· Identify alternative resources, community linkages to support client needs

· Assist domestic violence survivors and their families in achieving safety and self-sufficiency

· Conduct required home visits to clients

· Interface and collaborate with Westchester County Department of Social Services and other service providers

· Maintain case files as required by governing body standards and CHHOP requirements

· Review budgeting practices with client as an ongoing practice

· Develop engaging methods of service delivery for domestic violence survivors, while understanding the sensitivity and trauma informed approach necessary in serving survivors and their children who have experienced domestic violence

· Remain current on domestic violence best practices and the resources available for safe housing and make sure clients are well informed.

· Build community relationships on behalf of the client

· Provide strong case plans for each client based on agreed goals

· Support the client in their progress and keep them focused on meeting their goals

· Maintain demographic and other needed information regarding participants for use in statistical reporting through excel and other database programs.

· May require a flexible schedule.

· Other duties as required.

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience in the human services or related field.

· Minimum of two (2) years working with issues of domestic violence and a record of successfully facilitating change and/or innovation in domestic violence or related field.

· One-two (1-2) years of experience in homelessness, substance abuse, mental health and child abuse.

· Valid New York Driver’s License, car insurance and personal vehicle.

· Ability to build supportive and respectful working relationships with staff and clients alike

· Proven ability to work independently and as a team, being an effective and collaborative leader

· Skilled at communicating with a team

· Maintain responsibility for individual work but sharing the responsibility of the overall success of the program.

**Skills and Abilities:**

· Good oral and written skills

· Good time management skills, able to handle multiple tasks and assignments at the same time

· Self-starter, flexible and easily adaptable

· Attentive to detail

· Proficient in Internet research, E-mail, data bases, and Microsoft programs

· Ability to provide accurate, timely reports as requested.

**Salary Range: $58, 000+, medical and other benefits**

**To Apply: Submit cover letter and resume to https://www.chhop.org/jobs. No calls, please.**

We strongly encourage people of color, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. CHHOP is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $58,000.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

* Peekskill, NY 10566 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Pest Control Technician
description:
**Pest Control Technician**

**Location**: Branch Office in Ridgefield, CT (Services Fairfield County and/or Litchfield County, CT)

**Pay Range**: $21 - $24/hr (pay dependent upon experience)

**JP McHale Pest Management LLC**, an Anticimex Company, is one of the top professional pest control companies nationwide. Our *Ridgefield Branch* is looking for experienced Pest Control Technicians.

As a Pest Control Technician in **Ridgefield*****,*** **CT** with JP McHale Pest Management LLC, you will provide the vital link between our company and our clients through exceptional customer service. The Pest Control Technician will seek to solve existing pest problems and recommend corrective actions to prevent future pest problems. Overall, you'll spend your day helping other people in your community by solving their pest challenges, building long-term relationships with those on your route, and protecting their homes and businesses.

**Essential Job Functions and requirements:**

* Knowledge of pest control products, services, treatments, regulations, and safety procedures are preferred
* Ability to obtain CT Jr. Operator License within 30 days of hire.
* CT driver's license
* **Must have at least 3 years of driving experience** to drive a company vehicle.
* Ability to enter/exit structures and crawl spaces, climb over and on top of structures, ascend and descend stairs and ladders.
* Ability to use required personal protective equipment.
* Ability to visually inspect for pests, pest entries, etc.
* Ability to tolerate variety of environmental conditions, including seasonal weather, damp and/or dusty locations.
* Follows all JP McHale Pest Management Company policies, procedures and guidelines.
* Follows OSHA/FIFRA policies and procedures when carrying out pest control services.
* Operates company vehicle safely; and maintains vehicle to comply with DOT and company guidelines.
* Completes services as scheduled and provides appropriate documentation of services performed.
* Acts quickly and effectively to address actual or potential problems.
* The ability to meet the physical demands of the job; walking, bending, kneeling, climbing, lifting & carrying up to 40 lbs., etc.

**Why work for JP McHale Pest Management?**

**We offer:**

HEALTH BENEFITS

* Medical, dental and vision coverage
* Company-paid life insurance
* Company-paid short-term disability
* Optional supplemental benefits
* Enrollment eligibility begins first of the month following date of hire

FINANCIAL ASSURANCE

* Employees paid on a weekly basis
* 401(k) plan with company match of 4%
* Immediate enrollment eligibility
* Convenient direct paycheck deposit
* Team Member reward and recognition program
* Employee would be eligible for company bonus programs

AND MORE

* Eight (8) paid holidays
* Paid time off eligibility begins the first day of employment
* Team Member referral bonuses
* Opportunities to participate in community events

***\\*\\*Equal Opportunity Employer\\*\\****

*\\*\\* We are an equal opportunity (M/F/V/D) employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.\\*\\**

title: Clinic Manager - Florham Park
description:
Bond Vet is on a mission to strengthen the human-animal bond through better pet care. We offer primary and urgent care, so we're there for pets when they need us most. Our clinics are designed with pets and people in mind: warm, friendly, and highly sniffable. We balance this design with a strong focus on technology, all built in-house, which means we can easily innovate our systems to improve the veterinary team, pet, and client experience.

  



### **The Opportunity:**



Bond Vet is building the next generation of veterinary clinics from the ground up — and we're looking for a collaborative **Veterinary Clinic Manager** to join our team.



Our Veterinary Clinic Manager will lead our clinic team (veterinarians, technicians, assistants + care coordinators) and oversee day-to-day operations. You are a reliable, proactive, and conscientious leader who is dedicated to the success of your team.



This is a full time position.


### **What You'll Do:**


* Oversee the day-to-day operations of the clinic
* Manage your clinic's P&L
* Mentor, develop, and lead clinic team members to excel
* Balance the needs of the clinical team with the goals of the organization
* Collaborate with our operations team to scale operations and implement processes
* Own customer relations
* Lead weekly team meetings & daily team check-ins
* Create clinic schedules
* Identify areas of opportunity to increase efficiency and then implement improvements
* Ensure team members complete their daily checklists
* Recruit, interview, and onboard new team members
* Foster a sense of community within the team

### **You Have:**


* 4+ years of experience managing professionals in complex organizations in the veterinary space (or translatable experience) is considered ideal but not required
* Experience supervising front desk operations
* Experience with compliance and safety policies
* Strong organizational and leadership skills
* CVPM designation is considered ideal but not required

### **We Offer:**


* Competitive pay | varies based on experience
* Team-Based Profit Sharing Bonus - together we all win.
* Membership to the VHMA
* CVPM Prep course for those pursuing CVPM certification
* Opportunities for Tuition Assistance for staff pursuing LVT/CVT/RVT
* CE Stipend & Additional Time Off for CE for licensed individuals to keep your mind and skills sharp
* 401(k) with partial employer match
* Generous paid time off
* Parental leave of up to 16 weeks paid over your time at Bond
* Discounts on in-clinic services for pets
* Membership to Rocket Lawyer
* Commuter Benefits
* Medical, dental & vision plan options
* Access to mental health support via EAP, Talkspace, & Ginger through medical plan provider and MyStrength
* HSA plan option with employer contribution
* Figs scrubs & stocked pantries to keep you comfortable and full all day long!

  


**Our Values:**
**We're obsessed with pets:** The love we feel for animals drives us to do our best. We work with initiative, positivity and warmth to bridge the gap between human and pet, focusing on wellness to keep a better, stronger bond.
**We work as a team:** We're knowledgeable, friendly, and passionate about a better veterinary experience. We jump at the opportunity to help one another and seek out opportunities to team up on tasks. We're all in this together - our team, pet owners, and the animal - and our success as a team hinges on all of us doing our best.
**We communicate clearly:** We speak up, we do what we say, and we're transparent and honest. We value clear, simple communication.
**We work happy:** We bring a happy, positive attitude to work because it impacts the energy in the office.
**We're empowered:** We're building a new kind of vet experience, and every team member is empowered to try new things and own their decision-making.

*By submitting an application you agree to receive SMS messages from Bond Vet and third parties retained by Bond Vet regarding your application and interview process, including, but not limited to, your interviews, scheduling, offers, reference checks, background checks, and general communication throughout the process. Opt out anytime by messaging STOP. Msg & data rates may apply.*
  

*Bond Vet provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.*
company_description: Bond Vet is on a mission to strengthen the human-animal bond through better pet care. We’ve rebuilt the vet clinic from the ground up, with a focus on team happiness, growth, and development.

title: Manager, Data Adoption and Change Management
description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered  

# 162360 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States  

  

**Who We Are**  

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a caring, innovative growth company that is reimagining a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. Focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, we sell our products in more than 200 countries and territories under brands such as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, hello, meridol, Sorriso, Tom’s of Maine, EltaMD, Filorga, Irish Spring, PCA SKIN, Protex, Sanex, Softsoap, Speed Stick, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Pet Nutrition.  

  

We are recognized for our leadership and innovation in promoting sustainability and community wellbeing, including our achievements in decreasing plastic waste and promoting recyclability, saving water, conserving natural resources and improving children’s oral health.  

  

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile and join our global team!

  

Are you passionate about driving transformational change and all things data? We are seeking an experienced Adoption & Change Manager who will support the groundbreaking change of our workforce to be data minded and driven to run our business. They will be responsible for leading and implementing data change initiatives that support our organization's strategic objectives to treat our data as a strategic asset and handle it appropriately. To be successful, the manager will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that changes are delivered in a controlled and coordinated manner.

 **What you will do**

* Contribute to the strategy development to transform an organization, leverage change management methodology, process and tools to implement a plan in business processes and procedures
* Enable the design, development, delivery and management of key communications
* Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness, and identify key decision makers
* Participate in the design and delivery of training programs, workshops and all customer interactions and touchpoints
* Identify and work through anticipated resistance to change, and develop plans to mitigate risks. Facilitate change management activities with cross-functional team members and stakeholders to understand and ensure adoption of changes
* Create and implement measurement systems to track adoption, utilization, and proficiency of changes in regards to data, data governance and data management

 **Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in organizational psychology, education or similar field
* 6-8 years of proven experience in driving large transformational change in multinationals organizations
* Knowledge of change management principles, methodologies, and tools (e.g., Prosci ADKAR Model, Kotter's 8-Step Change Model).
* Knowledge of workshop facilitation, change management methodologies and tools, program and project management and adult education
* Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and guide cross-functional teams effectively
* Exceptional strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities, coupled with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality products

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* PROSCI certification

 **Compensation and Benefits**  

Salary Range $103,000.00 - $155,000.00 USD  

  

Pay is based on multiple non-discriminatory, individualized factors including but not limited to experience, job-related knowledge and education, skills and office/market location. In addition to base salary, salaried employees are eligible for annual discretionary bonuses, profit-sharing and, for Executive-level (salary grade 16 and above) roles only, long-term incentives in the form of Restricted Stock Units and/or Stock Options.  

  

Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable benefits plans then in effect, all salaried employees are also eligible for a competitive benefits package which includes:

* Insurance: Employees (and their eligible dependents) are eligible to participate in Company-sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment and Disability insurance plans.
* Retirement Plans: Employees are eligible to enroll in Colgate's 401(k) plan, which provides for company matching contributions subject to eligibility requirements
* Vacation/PTO: Employees receive a minimum of 15 days of vacation/PTO leave annually
* Paid Holidays: Employees receive a minimum of 13 paid/floating holidays annually
* Paid Sick Leave: Based on location and consistent with applicable state and local law, employees receive a minimum of 40 hours of paid sick leave on January 1st of each year
* Paid Parental Leave: Eligible employees may take up to eight weeks of paid parental leave and 12 weeks of unpaid leave (varies for employees with fewer than 12 months of service and is subject to hours worked requirements)

 **Our Commitment to Sustainability**  

With the Colgate brand in more homes than any other, we are presented with great opportunities and new challenges as we work to integrate sustainability into all aspects of our business and create positive social impact. We are determined to position ourselves for further growth as we act on our 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy.  

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**  

Achieving our purpose starts with our people — ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve —and creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.  

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**  

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application\\_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.  

  

For additional Colgate terms and conditions, please click here.

title: Customer Service Desk Attendant
description:
***Overview:***

Join the World of Bowling! Here at Bowl 360, We pride ourselves on excellent guest experience. As a Customer Service Desk Attendant, you are the first point of contact for our facility. This position is front line of support for customers, and you help ensure that customers are satisfied with services. We are looking for customer focused, detailed oriented individuals who can overcome any issues our guest is facing. You must be reliable, outgoing, and be able to maintain an upbeat attitude. Cross train for all positions as time allows.

***Responsibilities***:

* Greeting, welcoming, and directing guests
* Maintain an upbeat attitude, remaining focused on customer needs
* Manage the waitlist
* Track availability and assign lanes, shoes & other equipment
* Operate our POS system, central panel, computers, and P/A system
* Answering and forwarding incoming phone calls
* Verify that lanes are cleaned and sanitized before directing guests to it
* Verify credit card information matches the same customers ID before processing
* Verifying no counterfeit bills are collected
* Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone/email
* Acknowledging and resolving customer complaints or contact management for unresolvable issues
* Ensure customer satisfaction and provide professional customer support
* Process sales transactions, Accept payments
* Complete all daily tasks, as assigned on daily job duties, game room, glass doors, garbage removal, dropping balls, wiping monitor screens, etc.
* Keeping Ping Pong room safe and free from damage, including paddles, balls, floors, couches, tables, etc.

***Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities***:

* Must meet the minimum age required by state law to serve alcohol
* Proficient in English (oral and written)
* Excellent knowledge of MS Office (especially Excel and Word)
* Strong communication and people skills
* Good organizational and multi-tasking abilities
* Problem-solving skills
* Customer service orientation
* Ability to stand for long periods of time, bend, twist, and lift over 50 lbs.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
