title: FULL-TIME ASSISTANT MANAGER
description:
At Hot Topic, we’re passionate about a few things: music, pop culture, and creating the most amazing in-store experience for our customers and employees. We’re on the search for a Full-Time Assistant Manager that will help lead the loudest store in the mall. You’ll support the Store Manager in achieving store objectives with regards to hitting sales targets, recruiting, and development. You’re Harry Potter and Luke Skywalker rolled into one; you can handle anything that comes your way while driving sales and building lifelong relationships with our customers.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* Support your Store Manager in achieving the sales plan and/or comp sales goals. It’s not all about the Benjamins, but then it kind of is
* Help recruit, develop, and retain a super collaborative, passionate team to run your store alongside you
* You’re the store’s #1 fan – you’ll create buzz and customer engagement through promotion of new products, use social media platforms, and additional benefits such as BOPIS and curbside pickup
* Provide leadership around running an operationally sound business; you’ll bring the right balance of ops, delegation/autonomy, and customer-first selling practices
* Keep watch (like the Night’s Watch) on shrink/loss prevention, payroll hours, and associate schedules
* Collaboratively communicate with retail leadership and HQ partners on trends & customer feedback
* Run sales reports and use data to help guide your strategy to hit sales targets
* You’ll merchandise the store in a compelling way, leveraging planograms as a guide, while launching all promos on time. In short, you’ll deliver the goods!
* Every Frodo needs a Fellowship! In partnership with your Store Manager, you’ll develop your team of loyal associates that are high-performing and customer-focused

**WHAT YOU'LL NEED**

* At least 1-2 years of retail store management experience. If you love music and pop culture, you're in the right place!
* You’ve led teams to success and want to experience more of it. You’ll have skills to pay the bills: communication, recruiting, operations (payroll, reporting, scheduling, merchandising), and be a developer of your peeps
* You have Avenger-like skills: communication, time management, professionalism, operations, and a drive to develop your peeps
* A high school diploma or GED equivalent. If you have a degree, even better
* Roll with the punches. Retail is a fast-changing industry and you like catching curveballs thrown your way
* The usual retail stuff (with or without reasonable accommodation): able to navigate your way around the store, merchandise product utilizing approved store equipment, and pack and unpack boxes of awesome merch that may weigh up to 50 pounds

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.75 - $23.70 per hour

title: Grants Manager
description:
Job Description


### **General Description**


The Grants and Partnerships Office at Bronx Community College is seeking an experienced Grants Manager to join the team. The Grants Manager, reporting to the Director of Grants and Partnerships, will assist PIs with all aspects of pre-and post-award activities such as preparing and assembling proposals, interacting with other entities & departments to facilitate proposal development & reporting, assisting with budget management responsibilities for projects as well as monitoring terms of agreements for compliance purposes & communicate with appropriate parties as needed as a resource and liaison to the departments & PIs.


#### **Other Duties**


* Assist faculty and staff in preparing and assembling grant proposals/contracts in compliance with sponsor, university, college, and agency regulations
* Assist faculty and staff in determining requirements, deadlines, and time management for responses to PA/RFA/FOAs or general application submissions in a proactive manner
* Coordinate multiple applications under absolute deadlines.
* Interact with other departments, institutions, and agencies to facilitate the development, submission, and administration of grant proposals.
* Assist faculty with award management and serve as a liaison with the Research Foundation of CUNY on behalf of faculty.
* Coordinates with the Research Foundation to assign fund account numbers, input contracts for review, processes wire transfers, and track fund account activity
* Provide data reports as necessary
* Performs other duties as assigned by the Grants and Partnerships Director
#### **Qualifications**


* Comprehensive knowledge of the field of grants proposal development, sponsored programs, and research administration
* Knowledgeable of federal, state, city, and private funding agencies, their guidelines, and policies and procedures
* Knowledge of major federal funding agencies, including the National Science Foundation, U.S. Department of Labor and U.S. Department of Education grant policies and procedures along with their associated portals (i.e., eRA Commons/ASSIST, Research.gov/Fastlane, G5)
* Knowledge of key office technology; ability to master software for tracking sponsored programs
* Ability to work independently and within a team
* Ability to resolve problems in a calm and effective manner and provide the highest level of customer service
* Ability to work effectively with internal and external constituents at all levels
* Ability to communicate effectively with diverse constituencies; ability to explain basic concepts to professional college staff, college officials, and the Research Foundation administrators
* Ability to listen and respond to the concerns/ideas of others
* Ability to write clearly and effectively for multiple stakeholder audiences
#### **RFCUNY Benefits**


***RFCUNY Employee Benefits and Accruals***
#### **About the Research Foundation**


The Research Foundation of The City University of New York (RFCUNY) was established as a not-for-profit educational corporation chartered by the State of New York in 1963. RFCUNY supports CUNY faculty and staff in identifying and obtaining external support (pre-award) from government and private sponsors and is responsible for the administration of all such funded programs (post-award).


RFCUNY stands between CUNY’s principal investigators (PIs) and the sponsors who support them and strives to fulfill its essential responsibilities to both groups. Working closely with individual PIs and Grants Officers on the campuses, RFCUNY oversees employment, accounting, audit, reporting, purchasing, and special responsibilities that include management of a planned giving program; liaison with governmental agencies and foundations; negotiation of agreements; facility construction and renovation; protection and commercialization of intellectual property; and compliance with applicable standards in research involving human subjects, animal care, environmental and radiological safety, and conflicts of interest.


#### **Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**


The Research Foundation of the City University of New York is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Americans with Disabilities Act/E-Verify Employer. It is the policy of the Research Foundation of CUNY to provide equal employment opportunities free of discrimination based on race, color, age, religion, sex, pregnancy, childbirth, national origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, domestic violence victim status, arrest record, criminal conviction history, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**Direct Support Professional DSP – IMMEDIATE hiring**

The role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP) is more than a job it is a career that makes a positive impact every day in the lives of people with intellectual disabilities and autism. As an DSP you are directly responsible for the people supported and their overall safety and well-being, helping them achieve a rich and full life. **OPWDD (Office for People With Developmental Disabilities) Experience a MUST in an IRA setting**

title: Nutritionist
company: Economic Opportunity Commission of Nassau County, Inc.
description:
**Job Summary:** The Nutritionist for the Head Start Program will be responsible for planning, implementing, and overseeing the nutritional components of the Head Start Program. The role involves assessing the dietary needs of young children, ages 3-5 years old, creating nutritious meal plans, educating families on healthy eating habits, and ensuring compliance with all federal, state, and local regulations. The Nutritionist will work closely with teachers, families, and other staff members to promote a healthy environment that supports the growth and development of children.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Nutritional Assessment and Planning:**
* Conduct nutritional assessments for all enrolled children, identifying any special dietary needs or food allergies.
* Develop and implement individualized nutrition plans for children with special dietary requirements.
* Create and review menus to ensure they meet the USDA Child and Adult Care Food Program (CACFP) guidelines and accommodate diverse cultural and dietary needs.
* **Program Implementation and Oversight:**
* Coordinate with kitchen staff to ensure meals and snacks are prepared according to approved menus and nutrition plans.
* Monitor food service operations to ensure food safety, proper sanitation, and compliance with Head Start performance standards.
* Maintain accurate records of children’s dietary needs, meal service, and any nutrition-related concerns.
* **Family and Staff Education:**
* Provide nutrition education and resources to families, including healthy eating habits, meal preparation, and the importance of nutrition in early childhood development.
* Conduct workshops or training sessions for staff and families on nutrition-related topics.
* Collaborate with the Family Services team to support families in accessing community resources for food security and nutrition.
* **Compliance and Reporting:**
* Ensure compliance with all Head Start performance standards, CACFP requirements, and other relevant regulations.
* Prepare and submit required documentation, including nutrition assessments, menu plans, and compliance reports.
* Participate in program evaluations and audits as required.
* **Collaboration and Communication:**
* Work closely with teachers, family advocates, health specialists, and other staff to integrate nutrition into the overall educational program.
* Participate in multidisciplinary team meetings to address the comprehensive needs of children.
* Serve as a liaison between the Head Start Program and community resources related to nutrition and food services.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition, Dietetics, or a related field required; Registered Dietitian (RD) credential required.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in nutrition, preferably in early childhood education or a community setting.
* Knowledge of USDA Child and Adult Care Food Program (CACFP) guidelines and Head Start performance standards.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to engage and educate families from diverse backgrounds.
* Ability to work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to lift up to 25 pounds.
* Ability to stand for extended periods during meal preparation and service.
* May require occasional evening or weekend work for family workshops or events.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $46,800.00 - $47,900.00 per year

License/Certification:

* Registered Dietitian (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Hempstead, NY 11550 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Bilingual Spanish language Instructor at after school program. pre-k (UES) Thursdays 1hr classes
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $75 per class. It's about a 1 hour 20 minute commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contactor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occassionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for Spanish Immersion**

Designed for young students, Spanish Immersion teaches conversational and basic Spanish language using Total Physical Response (TPR)- a "learn by doing" approach. Every activity has students speaking, listening, acting and learning, and is enriched by studies of Spanish and Latin American cultures!

This class comes with curriculum.

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $50 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

**Dates for the class:** 9/26/24 - 12/12/24

**Times:** 2:45pm- 3:25pm

**Grades:** prek-k

**Neighborhood:** Upper East Side (E. 70's)

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

description:

title: Assistant Manager Of Health Insurance Enrollment
description:
Position Summary: The Assistant Manager will assist New York residents with enrolling into the NY State of Health Insurance Marketplace and educate the public on the Marketplace. He or she will also assist in training new Navigators, managing employees and compiling weekly and monthly reports.



Responsibilities:


* Manages team toward achievement of it's contractual goal of 400 contracts monthly
* Assists Director on program management and promotion to target populations
* Assists the Director on achieving all milestones required by our contract
* Hires, trains, and supervises Benefits Navigators
* Manages partnerships and coordinates between different enrollment sites
* Assists program expansion plan and grant research
* Administers customer satisfaction surveys and collects client stories monthly
* Maintains NADAP’s client database
* Performs other duties as assigned


Qualifications:


* Bachelor's Degree required
* At least 1 year of staff management or supervisory experience
* At least 2 years experience working with the Health Insurance Marketplace or related health insurance experience
* In order to perform this job the individual must pass the Navigator training issued by NY State of Health or already be certified
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Approximately 50% travel within NYC boroughs
* Must be able to work nights and weekend as necessary
* Bilingual preferred in one of the common languages in NY, such as: Russian, Spanish, Chinese, French, or Korean.


Salary: $65,000/year



Schedule: Hybrid- 3 days on site, 2 days remote



Program Overview: Our Health Insurance Navigator (IPA) team currently helps New Yorkers enroll in the Health Insurance Marketplace in Manhattan but also Queens, Brooklyn and the Bronx.



Company Overview: NADAP is a multiservice non-profit agency dedicated to helping people with medical, behavioral health and social service needs to become self-sufficient. NADAP programs assist disadvantaged populations in New York City and Long Island. NADAP's services include health insurance enrollment, assessment, care coordination, case management, professional training, job preparation and placement services. NADAP is dedicated to building a culturally diverse workforce, one that aspires to promote an environment that welcomes and supports diversity, equity, inclusion and affirms equal opportunities for all. Visit us at www.nadap.org.

title: NYS Workers Compensation Group Self Insured Director
description:
**Title:** NYS Workers Compensation Group Self Insured Director

**Rate of Pay:** $288,052.67 (Weekly: $5,230.76 + $201.02 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Full-time, Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department:** Electrical Employers Self Insurance Safety Plan (EESISP)

**Location:** Flushing/Fresh Meadows, NY 11365

**Shift:** Full Time Onsite 35 Hours per Week - Monday – Friday 8:30-4:30, must be available for emergencies evenings and weekend via phone.

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

The Electrical Employers Self Insurance Safety Plan (EESISP) is the largest and oldest group self-insured trust fund in New York State. For over 50 years, it has provided workers’ compensation and disability coverage to the members of Local Union No. 3, IBEW and affiliated employers. Since its inception, EESISP has paid over $1 billion in indemnity benefits and medical costs related to on the job injuries. In 1996, EESISP created a model Alternate Dispute Resolution and managed care program for workers’ compensation in New York.

**Work Environment**

This job operates in a professional office -- customer service environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as desktop computers, phone, scanner, printer, keyboard, photocopiers, shredder, and fax.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Travel** -- No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Thorough working knowledge of NYS Workers Compensation Law & Disability Law
* Minimum of 15-20 years experience in the field
* Must have Insurance Industry managerial experience
* Experience managing a staff of 20 employees
* Experience in: Claims handling and supervision of claims examiners; Setting Reserves; Financial Management; Interacting with auditors, actuaries, accountants and attorneys; Setting goals and managing a team to accomplish those goals; Reporting to the Board of Directors
* Ability to interact with high level personnel at NYS WCB in Albany
* Familiarity with ADR programs and working in a Union environment helpful
* Other duties as assigned

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**HIPAA Compliance Required**

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Full-Time Benefits Package:**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K without mandatory matching, vested immediately before FICA gross reimbursement.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date-Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, no employee premium coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, DDS/Empire Dental, in addition eligible employee may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* NYS Paid Family Leave
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Two Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $288,052.67 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Workers' compensation law: 10 years (Required)
* Insurance Industry Managerial: 5 years (Preferred)
* Claims handling and setting reserves: 5 years (Preferred)

title: Political Canvasser
description:
**About Us:** Join a passionate political campaign dedicated to making a positive impact in our community. We are seeking motivated and enthusiastic individuals to help us engage with voters and build support for our candidate, who is committed to addressing key issues that matter to our district.

**Job Description:** As a Canvasser, you will be at the forefront of our grassroots efforts. Your role will involve directly engaging with voters door-to-door, discussing key issues, and encouraging support for our campaign. Your work is essential in ensuring our message reaches every corner of our district.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Engage with voters through door-to-door canvassing in assigned neighborhoods.
* Educate community members about the campaign’s platform, key issues, and upcoming events.
* Distribute campaign literature and answer questions about the candidate’s positions.
* Collect feedback and relay important voter concerns to the campaign team.
* Accurately record interactions and voter preferences using provided tools and software.
* Represent the campaign in a positive and professional manner at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Passion for political engagement and community service.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Comfort with walking and standing for extended periods.
* Reliable transportation.
* Previous canvassing or political campaign experience is a plus but not required.

**Why Join Us:**

* Be part of a movement to create positive change in your community.
* Gain valuable experience in political campaigns and grassroots organizing.
* Flexible hours to accommodate your schedule.
* Opportunity to earn performance-based bonuses.
* Meet like-minded individuals and build a network of connections.

**How to Apply:** Interested candidates should send their resume to yiatinforny@gmail.com with the subject line "Canvasser Application." Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply early!

Join us in making a difference—one conversation at a time.

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

title: Sales Representative
description:
**Job Overview:**

We are seeking a dynamic Sales Representative to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving sales and revenue growth through effective market analysis, account management, and exceptional customer service. They will be responsible for the ***Queens and Long Island Market***, with potential for growth into the other boroughs

**Overall Responsibilities:**

The position is primarily tasked with setting quotas, evaluating and adjusting performance, and developing processes that drive sales.

**Objectives of the Position:**

1. Represent the company with a comprehensive understanding of the company’s offerings.

2. Meet with potential customers and grow long-lasting relationships by understanding their needs.

3. Create and execute a strategic plan that expands customer base and extends territory reach.

4. Research customer needs and identify how the solutions meet them.

5. Achieve the company objectives through effective planning, setting sales goals, analyzing performance data, and projecting future performance.

6. Build and nurture customer relations by using effective sales tactics to meet revenue objectives.

**Responsibilities and Duties:** 

1. Nurturing existing customer relationships and develop relationships with potential customers within specific territory.

2. Visit and contact prospective clients to establish selling opportunities.

3. Visit sites to assess gather information from customers.

4. Manage displays, samples, and sell tools for customer availability.

5. Assist customers by providing knowledge and training the company products to their store personnel, to ensure personnel is able to present product and negotiate well with customers.

6. Prepare proposals, quotes, contracts and orders for potential customers.

7. Quota prices discuss credit terms, and prepare sales contracts for customer orders.

8. Estimate the date of delivery to the customer based on the understanding of the company’s delivery schedules.

9. Review and analyze various sales reports to identify sales potential with current customers and potential new customers.

10. Utilize any and all marketing tools such as catalogs, brochures to broaden reach in territory and promote company products.

11. Research and analyze customer needs and demands based on market information.

12. Investigate and resolve customer claims /problems with deliveries, returns and credits.

13. Attend trade show throughout the year as required.

14. Travel 50% locally, occasionally nationally, and /or internationally.

Prepare and maintain monthly sales report as required.

15. Other responsibilities as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

1. Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business administration.

2. At least **3** years of sales experience in the quartz industry.

3. Proven track record of success and the sales cycle form plan to close.

4. Ability to travel at least 50% of the time.

5. Have strong analytical skills, excellent leadership abilities, and exceptional customer service skills with ability to pay attention to detail.

6. Excellent communication and inter-personal skills, reporting skills and ability to analyze Information.

7. Must be able to work without direct supervision.

8. High level of Integrity.

9. Self-driven, ambitious, able to work autonomously, be results orientated and determined with a passion to succeed.

10. Must be a quick learner with strong negotiating skills.

11. A team player who recognizes the importance between balancing internal and external relationships.

12. Commission will be paid upon completed sales

\\*\\*Note: Applicant MUST complete Skills Assessment to be Applicable for this role. Applicants will be immediately refused of the position if assessments are not completed.

title: Workers Compensation Claims Associate
description:
**Job Title:** Claims Associate (Workers Compensation)

**Rate of Pay:** $67,780.57 ($1,203.76 weekly+ $99.71 weekly FICA reimbursement)

**Department:** EESISP

**Location:** On-site Fresh Meadows, NY

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Reporting to the Supervisor, under close supervision, the Claims Associate ‘B’ Grade 8 will perform various duties including but not limited to:

* Review of electrical industry workers' compensation claims and determine compensability.
* File all required workers compensation forms timely.
* Oversee medical management and investigations of claims.
* Calculate payroll and compensation payments based on set guidelines.
* Serve as liaison and interface with Magna Comp nurse and claimant as part of the review process.
* Assign cases for investigations and review progress.
* Prepare workers compensation claims for long-term disability.
* Ability to evaluate the degree of disability and scheduled loss value.
* Maintains a professional relationship with all appropriate parties involved with the claim.
* Refers cases as appropriate to management.
* Actively executes appropriate claims activities to ensure consistent delivery of quality claims service.
* Develops and manages claims through well-developed action plans; continues to work on the action plan to bring the claim to an appropriate and timely resolution.
* Analyzes and processes workers’ compensation claims by investigating and gathering information to determine the exposure on the claim.
* Communicate with Local 3 Business representatives regarding claims management.
* Perform other duties and special assignments as necessary.

**Work Environment**

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30 PM.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel**

No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* A four-year college degree required.
* A minimum of 3 years of experience as a workers’ compensation examiner required.
* Extensive knowledge of NYS Disability and Worker’s Compensation laws.
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Word & Excel.
* Must be able to work independently and collectively.
* Familiarity with claim reserve.
* Must possess the ability to make sound judgments.
* Strict confidentiality.

**Other Duties/Special Projects**

title: Bilingual French language Instructor for kids after school program. Grades: prek-k (1hr sessions)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $50 per class. It's about a 1 hour commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contractor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occasionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for French Immersion** 

Parlez-vous français? Would you like to learn French? Grammar and conjugation rules will be taught but we do not use the “by heart” method, we favor the intuitive aspect of learning through original activities. You'll learn typical French expressions, pronunciation and French culture too. Lessons are presented in an interactive, colorful way- full of games, riddles, jokes, and animations to help time fly by!

This class does not come with a curriculum and you must develop your own..

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $60 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

Class Specifics

Neighborhood: Upper East side (E.70's)

Dates: 9/23/24 - 12/9/24 (Mondays)

Time: 2:45pm -3:25pm

Grades: Prek-k

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, chess, soccer, programmable robots, French Immersion, LEGO, Spanish Immersion, Digital Photography, Healthy Kids Club, Music Kids, Pokemon Arts Academy, Group Piano, and Hip Hop dancing.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)
* Experience with children: 1 year (Required)
* Classroom management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Employment Specialist, NEI
description:
Position Summary: Employment Specialist provides employment and career counseling, job preparation, job development, job referral and retention to Nassau Employment Initiative (NEI) participants.



Responsibilities:


* Conduct individualized assessments and provides vocational counseling
* Source job opportunities in Nassau and Suffolk Counties
* Establish relationships with staffing and temp agencies
* Create resumes and cover letters for clients
* Provide one-on-one career counseling and job preparation for program
* Provide post employment services to clients
* Work closely with Senior Vocational Case Manager in the recruitment of clients, collecting data, and helping to meet the program goals
* Attend community events to conduct outreach and engagement


 Qualifications:


* Bachelors Degree Required
* Three years of relevant experience (experience working with HIV population is a plus)
* Bilingual Spanish Strongly Preferred
* Ability to travel 25% of the time


Salary: $42,000/year



Schedule: Working 5M to F on site.



Program Overview: The Nassau Employment Initiative (NEI), funded by the NY State Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance, is designed to provide outreach, case management, job preparation and job placement along with wrap-around services to individuals with HIV/AIDS in Nassau and Suffolk Counties. The program also provides post-placement supports and off site referrals to meet the needs of our participants.



NADAP, Inc. is a multiservice non-profit agency dedicated to helping people with medical, behavioral health and social service needs to become self-sufficient. NADAP programs assist disadvantaged populations in New York City and Long Island. NADAP's services include health insurance enrollment, assessment, care coordination, case management, professional training, job preparation and placement services. NADAP is dedicated to building a culturally diverse workforce, one that aspires to promote an environment that welcomes and supports diversity, equity, inclusion and affirms equal opportunities for all. Visit us at www.nadap.org

title: Client Success Manager, Enterprise
description:
Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is the leading digital presence platform for multi-location brands, with thousands of customers worldwide. With one central platform, brands can seamlessly deliver consistent, accurate, and engaging experiences and meaningfully connect with customers anywhere in the digital world. Our AI and machine learning technology powers the knowledge behind every customer engagement, which is only possible through our team of innovators and enthusiastic collaborators. Join us and experience firsthand why we are consistently recognized as a 'Best Place to Work' globally by industry leaders such as Built In, Fortune, and Great Place To Work®!


We are looking for **Enterprise Client Success Managers** with a strong background in digital. You will be responsible for new client implementation and relationship management as well as ensuring adoption and engagement with the Yext platform. Client Success Managers play an integral role in our business, building strong working relationships with each and every client and driving annual renewals and upsells. Client Success Managers will work with cross-functional teams including Sales, Business Development and Product Management to accelerate usage and relay client needs.  

  

**What You'll Do**


* Establish consultative and trusted relationships with clients
* Ensure client expectations are exceeded consistently
* Drive upsell opportunities into Yext's existing client base
* Transition new clients into the company seamlessly and create consistent process across all clients
* Develop best practices and process strategies
* Understand client business goals and anticipate future needs to deliver optimal solutions
* Drive planning sessions to ensure client is able to fully leverage Yext to meet their performance and operational efficiency goals
* Conduct quarterly business reviews and check in points with key clients
* Phenomenal communication skills and organized project management
* Elicit client feedback to act as internal advocate for our clients
* Communicate regularly with the customer to evaluate satisfaction


**What You Have**


* BA/BS degree or similar college level education
* 2+ years of experience in Digital/Technology Account Management
* Superior client service and relationship skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Experience in data analysis and Excel work
* Leadership in developing world class client presentations/QBR leadership
* Ability to thrive in a fast pace environment with tight deadlines
* Die hard drive to make clients successful


**Bonus Points**


* Blend of consulting, search, technological and/or display experience
* Experienced in on-boarding clients; implementation and integration experience


#LI-DD1


Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext's policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.

title: OBGYN Front Office Coordinator (East Setauket)
description:
**OBGYN Front Office Coordinator (East Setauket)**  

  

**Overview:**  

Square Care Medical Group in partnership with Unified Women’s Healthcare New York is currently seeking an experienced, compassionate and dedicated individual to fill the position of Front Office Administrator in our ObGyn medical practice. Square Care Medical Group is the largest women's health organization on Long Island. We offer several specialties with 60 providers across 20 locations, and are a recognized leader in our industry.  

  

The Front Office Coordinator is responsible for performing various administrative tasks to ensure the practice runs efficiently. These duties include patient registration, insurance verification, clinical triage and maintenance of health records. Other duties include scheduling appointments, answering phones, and performing data entry. This candidate will ensure patients needs are met and assist in promoting a positive patient experience as outlined in our mission, vision, and values.  

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Welcomes patients, visitors, and outside vendors to the medical practice
* Patient registration and appointment scheduling
* Addresses patient inquires promptly
* Scanning and processing patient health information in EHR
* Verify patient insurance benefits and eligibility
* Collect and process patient balances
* Obtain prior authorization for office visits, and radiology services
* Answer patient questions and provides assistance and directions when necessary
* Process messages within EHR for patients and providers relating to patient care
* Performs other duties as needed
* Maintains all compliance standards as determined by the Medical Group

**Experience & Qualifications:**
* 1+ years of experience working as a medical receptionist or relevant role a plus
* Knowledge of diagnostic testing and triage
* Friendly, compassionate and energetic disposition
* Courteous to all patients and visitors
* Contributes to a positive and caring workplace culture
* Works well in a team setting as well as independently
* Excellent organization and time management skills
* Ability to multitask and manage responsibilities in a fast-paced work environment
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Office365 (Word, Excel, etc.) knowledge required
* Electronic Health Record experience preferred
* High School Diploma or equivalent GED required

**Job Types:** Full-time (On-Site)  

  

**Benefits:**  

401(k), 401(k) profit share, Dental insurance, Disability insurance, Flexible schedule, Flexible spending account, Health insurance, Life insurance, Paid time off, Vision insurance, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Supplemental Insurance
**Schedule:** Monday - Friday
**Pay:** $20.00 - $23.00 per hour
*\\*\\*The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future. When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, credentials, budget and internal equity).\\*\\**

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
**Title**
Warehouse Management / Operations Logistics  

  

As we continue to grow and flourish throughout the country, we are looking for quality candidates to join a strong, family oriented team to expand our brand and support an industry that has been hit hard with many challenges over the last few years. We have been recognized as #7 for PVF distributors in the Supply House Times Premier 150 and have highly competitive benefits that can't be beat. With a motto of "Built To Say Yes", why not join a team that will take care of you and provide indispensable knowledge in our field.  

  

**Summary**  

The Macomb Group, a recognized leading distributor in the Midwest for Pipe, Valve, and Fittings. We are looking for a full-time **warehouse management associate** to work at our Carlstadt, New Jersey location. The Macomb Group has differentiated itself from competitors by continually expanding our operations to provide unbeatable specialty services, a huge inventory, energy-efficient solutions, and exceptional customer service. We are looking for a motivated, enthusiastic, self-driven individual to join our growing team.  

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage inventory
* Manage incoming trucks
* Manage operations logistics
* Stocking inventory
* Packing orders
* Attending to customers
* Quality assurance
* Organization of products and materials on shelves
* Regular maintenance of warehouse upkeep
* Possible use of Lift Truck to move materials


  

**Requirements**
* High school diploma or equivalent preferred
* Regularly lift up to 25lbs
* Be able to walk, stand, or lift the entire shift
* Knowledge of PVF is a plus
* Experience and knowledge of P21 a plus
* Chauffeur's license is also a bonus.
* While industry experience is encouraged, it is not required in order to be successful in this role.


  

**Work Setting**
Carlstadt, New Jersey
Monday - Friday, day shift  

OT on some Saturdays, 8 AM - 12 PM  

  

**Benefits**
* PTO, paid holidays, birthday off with pay and jump starts
* GM and Ford vehicle discount
* Medical, company pays 75% of premium along with a free medical wrap
* Free telemedicine with medical enrollment
* Dental
* Vision
* Free $20K Life Insurance and AD&D
* Critical Illness and Accident insurance
* Short and Long Term Disability
* 401K program with a 25% match with no cap!


**Our Culture**
With over 25 locations in multiple states, each branch has created a culture within our company that stems from cooperation, teamwork and of course the notion that we are BUILT TO SAY ***YES***, not only to our customers but to you as well.
We often gather for company provided lunches, sponsor lunch and learn sessions to share our knowledge, and hold customer appreciation BBQs. We have seasonal sports competitions for employees to win prizes and tailgates for football and baseball.
We also celebrate you by rewarding work anniversaries, employee appreciation day celebrations, recognizing inside/outside sales leaders, honoring our vets, observing casual Fridays and much more!
  

Come join our team and see why our employees love The Macomb way!
company_description: We're proud to be a leading wholesale distributor of pipe, valves, and fittings for the Midwest region and beyond.

title: Safety Training and Development Coordinator
description:
**Title:** Safety Associate ‘A’ Grade 7 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $63,738.83 (Weekly: $1,131.98 + $93.77 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Location:** Flushing Onsite – Monday thru Friday

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry is seeking an experienced candidate with strong technical background to work in our Safety/Learning Management Department. The ideal candidate will have a strong help desk background to provide analytical and technical support to our Learning Management System users and all related stakeholders. The candidate will possess analytical, technical, and high-level customer service skills within eLearning environment and Microsoft office.

The Safety Department is responsible for delivery of safety training to these members, and also works together with the Employment department to vet out members for the foreman’s list.

Our Learning Management System manages the administration, documentation, tracking, course management, reporting and delivery of all Industry related courses for approximately 15, 000 users.

Under close supervision, reporting to Director and Supervisors, the Safety/LMS Associate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

* Serve as the first point of contact for members and JIB employees seeking technical assistance, both on and off premises.
* Assist members in registering for online courses and setting up voice authentication for those courses. This may be done using facetime or Google Duo.
* Record events and problems and their resolution in logs.
* Direct unresolved issues to the next level of support personnel.
* Assist in testing and rollout of new versions of LMS and content.
* Work with other departments to train and assist with LMS tasks.
* Set up user accounts, permissions, and passwords.
* Take photos for New York City DOB ID SST cards.
* Provide support to members for the New York City SST program including but not limited to outside training verification.
* Assist in the processing and mailing of SST certification cards using inhouse programs as well as NYC DOB Training Connect.
* Serve as the first point of contact for members contacting the Safety Department with questions on training or safety issues for the Safety Director.
* Administering live lockout/tagout courses using the LMS.
* Setting up classroom for lock out class.
* Processing lockout tags and certificates.
* Administering weekly foreman’s tickets and reports for the Foreman’s committee.
* Work with Local Union # 3 processing new members.
* Work with the Apprentice Department processing new Apprentices.

**Work Environment**

This job operates in a professional office -- customer service environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as desktop computers, phone, scanner, printer, keyboard, photocopiers, shredder, and fax..

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM.

Flexibility: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel** -- No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Proficient in Microsoft Office.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills.
* Customer-oriented and cool-tempered with good interpersonal skills and a proven ability to interact easily and cooperatively with end-users and peers.
* Proficient in Google Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Internet Explorer.
* Proficient in Microsoft Windows servers and Apple based products.
* Familiar with Facetime and Google Duo.
* Experience working with a Learning Management System.

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off.
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.
* Life Insurance.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $63,738.83 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Microsoft Office: 1 year (Required)
* Google Chrome: 1 year (Required)
* Firefox, Safari, and Internet Explorer: 1 year (Required)
* Facetime and Google Duo: 1 year (Required)
* Working with a Learning Management System: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Fresh Meadows, NY 11365 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Housekeeper
description:
Meridian Senior Living believes that Everyone Deserves a Great Life.


To us, a great life in our communities starts with great employees. What makes a great employee, you ask?


We believe a great employee is someone that understands that our work is hard yet rewarding, that team work truly makes the dream work, and that at the end of the day there is nothing more satisfying then making a difference in someones life.


**What do we offer to these great employees?**


* A solid benefits package (with several different plan options for you to choose from) complete with Medical, Dental, and Vision.
* 1800MD Telemedicine that is available to all employees *and* their family members at no cost! No enrollment required!
* Flexible Spending Account
* Company paid Life Insurance and Long-Term Disability
* Voluntary Benefits that include Short Term Disability, Accident Coverage, Critical Illness, and more!
* Pet Insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* 401K
* Employee Assistance Program
* Referral Bonus
* Employee Discounts (Enterprise, Staples, HD Supply, Office Depot, Sherwin Williams, and more!)

**What else do we offer?**


* We equip you with the ability to grow your career whether it be with us or another employer.
* A company culture that is dedicated to promoting integrity, joy, respect, and excellence!
* Life changing experiences with some of the best Residents an employee can ask for.

**Details about the Housekeeper position we are hiring for:**


As a Housekeeper, the primary purpose of your position is to maintain assigned areas in a clean, sanitary, safe, and attractive manner in accordance with established procedures and as directed by the supervisor assuring that the highest degree of cleanliness and sanitation is maintained at all times. In addition, this position performs the job duties for residents and with team members in a courteous and professional manner ensuring that resident safety and satisfaction is a priority.


**Requirements:**


* One-year related experience in a similar environment with on-the-job training preferred
* Must have compassion for and desire to work with the elderly
* Must be able to read, write and follow oral and written directions at a level necessary to accomplish the job
* Must demonstrate the ability to work responsibly as a team member as well as an individual
* Must meet all health requirements and pass background check

*Meridian Senior Living is an Equal Opportunity Employer*

title: Orientation Facilitator, CCMN
description:
Position Summary: Provides interactive and motivational orientation to HRA CareerCompass participants in-person and remotely, including administering and scoring assessment tests. Assists in providing additional workshops including job preparation, sector-based overview and instruction, job search assistance, on-line applications and resume preparation. The Orientation Facilitator works to develop and enhance clients’ work-related skills in preparation for job placement or other engagement activities in the HRA Career Pathways model.



Responsibilities:


* Facilitates daily motivational orientations for newly referred HRA CareerCompass clients by offering in-person and remote services.
* Conducts orientation and workshops utilizing prepared curricula and appropriate materials, integrating vocational concepts and professionalism in a classroom setting. Conducts interactive facilitation allowing for questions, comments and discussion from clients.
* Supports in conducting workshops on self-assessment and introduces on-line tools that are used in a group setting. Assessments workshops topics include interest, skills, values, etc.
* Assists with job readiness workshops for program participants on such topics as: resume preparation and writing, introduction to business sectors, online job applications and follow up, job search tools, using email, interviewing skills, workplace ethics, soft skills and business conduct, networking and financial literacy.
* Maintains contact with Career Service Coordinators (CSC) to transition clients to the one-on-one intake process immediately following orientation.
* Supports in administering and scoring the TABE Test, BEST Test and Best Literacy.
* Maintains and executes documentation, case notes and workflow through computer-based programs and technology that draws on basic software/computer skill set.
* Accurately creates labels and folders daily for all clients enrolled in the CareerCompass Program.
* Attends and participates in meetings, staff development sessions and in-service training as assigned.
* Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:


* High School Diploma required with at least 3 years related work experience; Bachelor’s Degree in education, vocational rehabilitation or social-service related field preferred.
* Some prior professional experience working with a public assistance population and/or within a community-based organization or the government sector, directly serving an under-resourced population required.
* Excellent platform skills with the ability to motivate and engage clients.
  


Salary: $41,000/year



Schedule: Working M to F on site.



Program Overview: NADAP's CareerCompass, one component in HRA’s initiative to address the unique needs of improving employment and training outcomes in NYC, provides orientation, comprehensive and individual employability assessments and service coordination for adults 25 years of age and older. As the first step in HRA’s programming, CareerCompass will identify and connect individuals to an education, training and/or employment track.

  


NADAP, Inc. is a multiservice non-profit agency dedicated to helping people with medical, behavioral health and social service needs to become self-sufficient. NADAP programs assist disadvantaged populations in New York City and NLong Island. NADAP's services include health insurance enrollment, assessment, care coordination, case management, professional training, job preparation and placement services. NADAP is dedicated to building a culturally diverse workforce, one that aspires to promote an environment that welcomes and supports diversity, equity, inclusion and affirms equal opportunities for all. Visit us at www.nadap.org.

title: Bilingual Spanish Career Services Coordinator, CCMN
description:
Position Summary: To provide comprehensive intake, assessment, service plan and coordination services for clients referred to CareerCompass. Assists clients in determining their career pathway and education planning. Assists in the career decision making process to help clients identify their strengths, experiences, and vocational interests. Support clients in making appropriate referrals based on assessment. Maintain on-going contact with CareerCompass clients that have been referred to CareerAdvance, Career Education Services or other HRA Programs/services. Assist Internship and Placement Coordinator with conducting follow-ups. Identify any personal and social barriers that may arise during employment or service placement and make appropriate referrals to assist the client. This is a full-time, on-site position.



Responsibilities:


* Work with participants to develop a comprehensive service plan based upon a thorough understanding of the individual’s interests, strengths, preferences and needs. This plan will be completed within two weeks of client referral to CareerCompass. Revise, update and implement service plan as needed to ensure consumer compliance.
* Conduct a one-on-one interview to collect information about the participant’s personal work history, barriers to employment, criminal history, personal/family background, and living situations. Identify barriers and issues that may result in participant being returned to HRA for further evaluation.
* Maintain and execute documentation and workflow through computer-based programs and technology that draws on basic software/computer skill set.
* Assist with the placement of program participants into CareerAdvance, Career Education Services or other HRA Programs/services. Provide periodic check-in and follow-up on clients referred.
* Conduct re-assessments on clients returned to CareerCompass and provide case management, counseling and assist in the re-direction of alternative programming that might be a better fit. For clients disengaged for more than 3 months, provide counseling and support to determine the reasoning for not participating.
* Taking the results of the TABE or SABE and other types of assessment instruments used in CareerCompass, determine the educational, skills level, and vocational interest of the participant. Complete HRA’s on-line employment plan.
* Coach clients on career exploration, job search, interviewing, resume development and job retention skills.
* Attend and participate in meetings, staff development sessions and in-service training as assigned.


Qualifications:


* Bachelor's degree preferred. In lieu of a Bachelor's degree, must have an Associate's Degree with a minimum of five (5) year of work related experience or must have a high school diploma or equivalency with a minimum of seven (7) year of work related experience.
* 3 years related experience working with public assistance population and/or working in employment services or in social service related field.
* Excellent public speaking skills with the ability to motivate and engage clients.


Salary: $52,500/year



Schedule: Working M to F on site.



Program Overview: NADAP's CareerCompass, one component in HRA’s initiative to address the unique needs of improving employment and training outcomes in NYC, provides orientation, comprehensive and individual employability assessments and service coordination for adults 25 years of age and older. As the first step in HRA’s programming, CareerCompass will identify and connect individuals to an education, training and/or employment track.



NADAP, Inc. is a multiservice non-profit agency dedicated to helping people with medical, behavioral health and social service needs to become self-sufficient. NADAP programs assist disadvantaged populations in New York City and Nassau County. NADAP's services include health insurance enrollment, assessment, care coordination, case management, professional training, job preparation and placement services. NADAP is dedicated to building a culturally diverse workforce, one that aspires to promote an environment that welcomes and supports diversity, equity, inclusion and affirms equal opportunities for all. title: Bilingual Russian Health Insurance Navigator
description:
NADAP, Inc. is seeking full-time **entry level Bilingual Russian Benefits Navigators** to provide health insurance enrollment and education to New York residents. If you are a recent high school or college graduate looking to get exposure to the insurance field and the nonprofit world, this job may be perfect for you!



The goal of our program is to educate and assist individuals and small businesses to enroll in the Health Insurance Marketplace including Medicaid, Child Health Plus, the Essential Plan, and Qualified Health Plans. The Bilingual Navigators will work with participants to enroll them online into the NY State Health Insurance Marketplace.



Responsibilites:


* Provides education and enrollment services to individuals and small businesses about the State’s healthcare plans and guides individuals through the Marketplace’s enrollment process
* Builds partnerships with local communities for enrollment and referral purposes and works at network partner sites to actively market and promote the program to target populations
* Achieves 50 monthly enrollment and partnership goals
* Enters service information into NADAP’s database, produces weekly enrollment reports, and writes post-event reports
* Works with onsite organizations to coordinate referrals for eligible participants
* Conducts outreach to community and participates in marketing events and identifies and contacts eligible participants, through face-to-face outreach, email, phone
* Schedules appointments with eligible participants, and follows-up with reminders, including phone and email contact
* Attends staff meetings, trainings and provides program updates to manager


Qualifications:


* Education: High school diploma required; Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Experience: Entry level; we provide complete training needed for this role
* **Bilingual speaker required- Russian**
* Proficient with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and online research
* Able to present in group settings
* Positive attitude, flexibility, attention to detail, strong organizational skills and an ability to multitask
* Ability to work flexible hours with a rotating schedule. Work late nights and on weekends on occasions
* Comfortable with field work (approx. 50%).


Salary: $50,000/year

title: Bids & Client Services Coordinator
description:
Bids & Client Services Coordinator - Operations
The Company
Christie’s, the world’s largest Art Business, is an incredibly exciting & enriching place to start or continue your career. Whether you work within one of our Specialist Art Departments or in our more Operational focused teams we are all working together with one common goal in mind: to continue the success of this over 250 year old company, steeped in history, bringing constant innovation whilst not forgetting our age old values; Respect, Passionate Expertise, Exceptional Client Service, Teamwork, Integrity, Business Judgement & Innovation. Colleagues across all departments are truly passionate about what they do and it is constantly inspiring to work with industry leaders across all segments of the business.
The Role
This is a hybrid role, with responsibilities in Bids and Client Services. The Representative will be responsible for understanding and assisting with the execution of all bidding channels. In advance of the sale this person will assist in processing telephone and absentee bids; Christie's LIVE registrations and troubleshooting; compiling and archiving sale records. They will collaborate with other Bid Department coordinators to create a seamless pre-sale/sale day/post-sale schedule. The Representative will also be responsible for assisting the Client Service Center as necessary in both front and back of house capacities. Duties to be performed in full compliance with department standards, including teamwork, high level of client service, accuracy, attendance and punctuality. Time between Bids and Client Services will be determined and scheduled by Department Supervisor(s).
Specific duties & responsibilities will include but are not limited to* Process requests from clients to participate in sales, ensuring their effective bidding via absentee, telephone and Christie’s LIVE
* Assist in monitoring multiple department inboxes as well as phone lines
* Master the Christie’s systems, including LIVE Bid Management, Dotcom Admin tool, JDE, COS
* Perform Client Service functions as assigned, including but not limited to Auction Estimates, Front Counter Duties, Online sale support, Live Chat, Auction Estimates, Sale Views, etc.
* Gather and monitor AML compliance information
* Carry out sale procedures, liaising with finance, specialists, and post-sale departments
* Communicate frequently with specialist departments
* Maintain sale files including auctioneering book for archiving and audits
* Communicate directly with internal and external clients (phone, email, live chat and in-person) adhering to Christie’s Client Service Standards
* Other duties as assigned by Manager


The Candidate* Bachelor’s degree preferred, or equivalent work experience
* Proficiency with numbers - reading, writing, hearing
* Ability to remain calm under pressure
* Willingness to comply with department and company standards of client service
* Excellent ability to focus in a busy and distracting environment
* Excellent ability to multi-task and prioritize, demonstrating excellent organizational skills
* Strong follow-up skills with attention to detail
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including superior written and spoken communication
* Knowledge of E-mail, Spreadsheet, and Word Processing software (Microsoft Office preferred)
* Ability to learn Christie’s systems •Strong teamwork abilities
* Reliable attendance and punctuality
* Flexible work hours (i.e. 7:30 am start time on sale days, some Saturday sales, some late evenings, some Sunday prep for occasional Monday sales)
* Second language a plus


The Benefits* Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision care plans for employees and dependents (On average, Christie’s pays 80% of total premiums)
* 401(k) Savings Plan – Christie’s provides a matching contribution up to 5% (subject to IRS limits)
* Life Insurance - 3x base salary up to $400k (100% paid by Christie’s)
* Disability Insurance (100% paid by Christie’s)
* Generous time-off and leave policies; including 100% Paid Family Leave up to 16 weeks.
* Fitness Reimbursement Program: reimbursement of eligible fitness fees and memberships up to $600 per year
* Annual Discretionary Performance Bonus Plan
* Commuter Benefits - Pre-tax money towards your daily commute with a Christie’s contribution of $21 per month
* Back Up Child & Elder Care – up to 10 days of back-up Child or Elder Care through Bright Horizons
* CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) Day- Each employee receives one paid day per year to dedicate their time to a charity of their choice.
* Perks and Discounts through Zo and Plum Benefits

* *Christie’s reserves the right to change company benefits at any time*


Compensation Range
Salary: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00

description:

The Company
Christie’s, the world’s largest Art Business, is an incredibly exciting & enriching place to start or continue your career. Whether you work within one of our Specialist Art Departments or in our more Operational focused teams we are all working together with one common goal in mind: to continue the success of this over 250 year old company, steeped in history, bringing constant innovation whilst not forgetting our age old values; Respect, Passionate Expertise, Exceptional Client Service, Teamwork, Integrity, Business Judgement & Innovation. The Bids/Client Service Assistant is responsible for delivering exceptional client service to internal and external clients in New York.
